sentences.en: A lot of propaganda has painted him as bad.
sentences.cn: 大量宣传把他说得很坏.

sentences.en: Art may be used as a vehicle for propaganda.
sentences.cn: 艺术可以用作为宣传的媒介.

sentences.en: Deliberately broadcasting enemy propaganda to our troops is treason.
sentences.cn: 故意向我军广播敌人的宣传是叛国行为.

sentences.en: For many people there was no fine partition between art and propaganda.
sentences.cn: 对许多人来说,艺术和宣传是划不清界线的.

sentences.en: He served up some powerful propaganda.
sentences.cn: 他提出一些有力的宣传.

sentences.en: He tackled the propaganda work and political education programs.
sentences.cn: 他全身心地投入宣传工作和思想教育工作.

sentences.en: M. Reynaud spoke of the impact of German propaganda upon rench moral.
sentences.cn: 雷诺先生讲起德国宣传对于法国士气的影响.

sentences.en: Politicians want a lap-dog press which will uncritically report their propaganda.
sentences.cn: 政客们想要的是不问是非、甘为他们搞宣传的哈巴狗一样的新闻媒体。

sentences.en: The Front adopted an aggressive propaganda campaign against its rivals.
sentences.cn: 该阵线采用激进的宣传手段对付它的对手。

sentences.en: The head of our propaganda committee was Chou Yi - chung.
sentences.cn: 我们的宣传队长是周逸群.

sentences.en: These reports clearly contain elements of propaganda.
sentences.cn: 这些报告明显带有一些宣传的意味。

sentences.en: They confiscated weapons, ammunition and propaganda material.
sentences.cn: 他们没收了武器、弹药和宣传材料。
他们散布反对法国的宣传资料。

sentences.en: They even set up their own news agency to peddle anti-isolationist propaganda.
sentences.cn: 他们甚至设立了自己的通讯社来宣扬反孤立主义。

trans.tran_en: information which is false or which emphasizes just one part of a situation, used by a government or political group to make people agree with them
